div.p: ACT out OR PRODUCE something so as to CAUSE it to BECOME WHOLE.
1. The standard word for finishing a task one has undertaken is chéng 成.
2. Jiù 就 refers to completing a process of production of something.
3. Jù 具 refers to the completion of a certain course of action.
4. Wán 完 emphasises the state of completeness not necessarily achieved through a deliberate strategy of action.
完成 is the most current modern word for completing or finishing something.
弄齊全 focusses on the solid finish.
成圓滿 (lit) refers to perfect completion.
完工 focusses on the work finished.
蕆 (obs) is to finish or complete.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: COMPLETE
perficere refers to the completion of an action.
consummare refers emphatically to carrying something through to the end.
COMPLETELY
plane means "completely".
omnino "altogether and generally".
prorsus "exactly".
penitus "thoroughly, deeply".
utique "at any rate, in any case".

be provided with all necessary qualifications; be perfectly prepared for everything
to be complete, to reach completion; to be realised completely

be perfectly realised, be carried out with complete success

sense.def: be completely present, without any element missing
complete (all the parts) together; combine completely together;

sense.def: be completed; be completely present, be in perfect shape; be intact
be complete and without rifts or openings; be watertight (WRONG SYNONYM GROUP?)

sense.def: bring to the point of completion
fill in (hole so as to make complete and repair); make up (defect)
cover the whole of, complete a contextually determinate distance

entry.def: The standard word for bringing anything to a successful conclusion is chéng 成.

sense.def: process of formation until its completion > completion, maturation
completed, achieved; completely present; completely established, ready-made; successful
come to completion, come to fruition
bring to fruition; practise successfully; to bring to completion; to bring to a successful conclusion; to accomplish; give its full form to; to make complete and perfect

make (oneself) perfect and complete; achieve one's own purposes

go through with (the performance of one's duties etc); carry through to success
be completed, be completely achieved; be completely understood; reach perfection
complete (a certain age > reach the age of)
realise completely, realise exhaustively; carry through successfully and completely
verbal complement indicating that an action/process is carried out/proceding until it is completed > fully VERB??
realise things completely, be completely successful with things
carry through to the end; carry out meticulously; get to the end of GY：究數而止
get carried out meticulously to the end
fill out with what is necessary
be completely in place; be completely maintained
be or become complete, be reconstituted in the original shape
without residue DCD: 1.沒有剩餘、殘留。 2.指沒有餘留之物。 3.指沒有多餘資財。 4.佛教語。指無餘涅槃，謂生死的因果泯滅，不再受生於三界。

bibl.title: Studies in the Language of Zu-tang Ji 祖堂集

note.p: bi4ji4ng 畢竟 originated in the Tang period. According to SONG YINSHENG 1996: 160-161 and 201-202 the word has two meanings: one is 'finally; in the last analysis; in the end; etc.'. And in the other meaning the adverb adds emphasis to a question corresponding to Modern Chinese jiu1ji4ng 究竟 'actually; after all'. According to SONG there are 6 examples of the first meaning in ZTJ and six in BIANWEN, 14 examples of the second meaning in ZTJ and none in BIANWEN (see also CAO GUANGSHEN 1984: 116). The word survived in both meanings into later periods (e.g. JINGDECHUANDENGLU; HONGLOUMENG). In the course of time several forms of writing for bi4ji4ng became common: bi4ji4ng 必竟, zhi3ji4ng 止竟, zhi4ji4ng 至竟, bi4 畢, ji4ng 竟, zhi3 止, zhi4 至, etc.(see also ZHANG XIANG 1953).

《祖堂集》虛詞研究 Zǔtáng jí xūcí yánjiū A Study of Function Words in Zǔtáng jí

sense.def: in the last analysis, finally, after all, ultimately
manage to make complete, bring into complete existence
be finished; be completed; come to an end
be all complete; be completely present

bibl.title: Studies in the Language of Zǔtáng jí 祖堂集

note.p: Typical main verbs appearing with complement que4 are:

fa4ng 放 'to release; let go', qi4 棄 'throw away', she3 捨 'remove'; shi1 失 'loose'; sha1o 燒 'burn'; li2 離 'to seperate; leave'; tuo1 脫 'to remove'; bo1 剝 'to peel'; ma2i 埋 'to bury'; chu2 除 'eliminate; get rid of'; hua4i 壞 'to destroy'; pa1o 拋 'to throw away; abandon'; chi1 喫 'to eat; drink'; tu3 吐 'to spit; vomit'; zhuo2 斫 'to chop off; cut'; hui4 諱 'to avoid'; wu1 污 'to stain; to defile'; ya3 啞 'to mute'; xia1 瞎 'to blind'; gua1n 關 'to shut; to lock'.

Most of the verbs belong to the semantic field V{remove} and que4 indicates that this removal is performed to its full, often resulting in the permanent removal, seperation from, or even destruction of the object. Often que4 also adds the notion that the object involved is beyond repair, i.e. the damaging affect on the object is permanent and not reversible.
“某甲自住此山，"Since I have lived on this mountain
未曾瞎卻一師僧眼。”I have never blinded the eyes of (i.e. deceived) a single monk."
“早是污卻也。”"It has already been defiled."
“除卻這個色，"After having removed this form,
還更有色也無？”is there an additional form?"
This is one of the rare examples where que4 follows a disyllabic verb (fa1-qia3n 發遣 'send away'):
行者隨童子到五祖處，The Postulant followed the child to the place of the Fifth Patriarch
五祖發遣卻童子後，and after the Fifth Patriarch had sent away the child
遂改盧行者名為慧能，he then changed the name of Postulant Lu2 to Hui4ne2ng,
授與衣缽，and bestowed the monk's robe and bowl [on him],
傳為六祖。giving him the transmission as Sixth Patriarch.

bibl.title: 《祖堂集》中的底（地），卻（了），著 Zǔtáng jí zhōng de dǐ (dì), què (liǎo), zhu (zhe) 中國語文 Zhongguo yuwen

note.p: Cao counts ca. 200 occurrences of complement 卻 in ZTJ, appearing with more than 70 different main verbs.

bibl.title: 《祖堂集》中的助詞‘去’ Zǔtáng jí zhōng de zhùcí 'qù' [The Auxiliary Word 'qu' in ZTJ] 中國語文 Zhongguo yuwen

note.p: Li remarks that also 去 can occasionally have the funtion of 卻 and that the phonetic value of the two words were very similar.

sense.def: verbal suffix specifying the direction of the action towards the speaker and the completion or successful performance of an action
= cou4 湊: be all accumulated at one place > be completely realized or grasped
